From S. Post Oak to U.S 290 is the west loop and it runs north and south.
From U.S 290 to U.S 90 is the north loop and it runs east and west.
From U.S 90 to S.H 225 is the east loop and it runs north and south.
Finally from S.H 225 back to S. Post Oak is the south loop and it runs east and west.
[this might help](https://www.google.com/search?q=houston+610+loop+with+directions safe=off rlz=1CDGOYI_enUS686US686 hl=en-US prmd=minv source=lnms tbm=isch sa=X ved=0ahUKEwigwdje19jTAhVF2IMKHZqAAnUQ_AUICigC biw=414 bih=660#safe=off hl=en-US tbm=isch q=houston+610+loop+with+legend imgrc=xQ77NHcmBPVM6M: spf=412)

I've been riding public transportation for almost 3 years now. At first it was out of necessity but now it's by choice. Luckily I had a job opportunity that only takes me 50 min to get to work by bus. I save on gas,insurance and car note. It cost me $24 to get to work for the whole month. I also give a co-worker $25 to bring me home after. The only reason I don't ride with him to work is because he likes to get there right on time and I like to be early. The only set backs are some of the drivers. The other morning my connecting bus was 11 min late but she still got off the bus so she could talk on the phone for another 6-7 min. Things like that really get to me early in the morning because most of us on the bus that early are just trying to get to work. I see it as them being inconsiderate. There are other downfalls to public transportation but like the saying goes "you get what you pay for."
